lesson.name: Intersectionality
lesson.content:
Intersectionality explains that we all have different identities that impact the way in which we move through the world. All of these identities interact in unique ways that in part shapes our experiences.

Intersectionality describes the process by which various “isms” -heterosexism (belief that being heterosexual is the ‘right’ way to be), racism, sexism, ablism, ethnocentrism (belief that your culture is ‘right’ and others’ are wrong), ageism, classism privileges certain identities and oppresses others. These ‘ism’s are systems of oppression.

History

Kimberle Crenshaw, a Black Feminist scholar coined the term intersectionality in her 1989 Article: Demarginalizing the Intersection of Race and Sex
